topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Creating an Object Server Resource Nodes

body.p: You must identify the control plane and node type/role when creating a resource node for Swift object servers.

ul.li: In the data/control_plane.yml file, identity the control plane that the object serves are associated with.

Identity the node type/role used by the Swift Object servers. In the following example, SWOBJ-ROLE is mentioned as server-role.
Add an entry to the resources item in the control-plane as follows:control-planes: - name: ccp region: region1 . . . resources: . . . - name: swobj resource-prefix: swobj server-role: SWOBJ-ROLE allocation-policy: strict min-count: 0 service-components: - ntp-client - swift-object

body.p: A Swift object server requires the following service components:

ul.li: swift-client is optionally added. This installs the python-swiftclient package on the server.

body.p: Resource nodes do not have a member count attribute. So the number of servers allocated with the SWOBJ-ROLE is the number of servers in data/servers.yml file with a server role of SWOBJ-ROLE.
